episodes.synopsis: This first chapter shows the birth of a new art form -- the movies -- and the passion that has always driven film, more than money and marketing.
episodes.title: Birth of the Cinema

episodes.synopsis: This is the fascinating story of the movies in the roaring '20s. We see how Hollywood became a glittering entertainment industry.
episodes.title: The Hollywood Dream

episodes.synopsis: We visit Paris, Berlin, Moscow, Shanghai and Tokyo in the 1920s to discover the places where moviemakers were pushing the boundaries of the medium.
episodes.title: The Golden Age of World Cinema

episodes.synopsis: We see how the coming of sound in the 1930s upended everything and witness the birth of new types of film: horror movies, Westerns, musicals and more.
episodes.title: The Arrival of Sound

episodes.synopsis: This chapter shows how the trauma of war made cinema more daring. We start in Italy, then go to Hollywood to chart the darkening of American film.
episodes.title: Post-War Cinema

episodes.synopsis: This chapter explores sex and melodrama in the movies of the 1950s. We discover James Dean, On the Waterfront and the glossy weepies of the time.
episodes.title: Sex & Melodrama

episodes.synopsis: We discover how French filmmakers in the late '50s and '60s planted a bomb under the movies and see how the new wave it caused swept across Europe.
episodes.title: European New Wave

episodes.synopsis: As the new wave in cinema sweeps around the world in the 1960s, we discover the films of Roman Polanski, Andrei Tarkovsky and Nagisa Oshima.
episodes.title: New Directors, New Form

episodes.synopsis: Paul Schrader discusses his screenplay for Taxi Driver, Robert Towne talks about Chinatown, and Charles Burnett explores Black American cinema.
episodes.title: American Cinema of the 70's

episodes.synopsis: This is the story of the movies that tried to change the world in the '70s. We start in Germany, then head to Britain, Italy, Australia and Japan.
episodes.title: Movies to Change the World

episodes.synopsis: This chapter explains how films such as Star Wars and Jaws were innovative, then travels to 1970s India to show how Bollywood was doing new things.
episodes.title: The Arrival of Multiplexes and Asian Mainstream

episodes.synopsis: This is the story of how brave filmmakers spoke truth to power. Director John Sayles discusses these years. We discover the growth of Chinese cinema.
episodes.title: Fight the Power: Protest in Film

episodes.synopsis: Cinema around the world in the '90s entered a golden age. The story starts in Iran, where we meet Abbas Kiarostami, who rethought moviemaking.
episodes.title: New Boundaries: World Cinema in Africa, Asia & Latin America

episodes.synopsis: This is the story of the movies in the English-speaking world in the '90s. We look at Quentin Tarantino's dialogue and the edge of the Coen brothers.
episodes.title: New American Independents & The Digital Revolution

episodes.synopsis: The series concludes by examining current-day cinema, then goes beyond the present to look at what the future holds for moviemaking.
episodes.title: Cinema Today and the Future

video.title: The Story of Film: An Odyssey
video.synopsis: This bold love letter to the movies is an epic journey through the history of world cinema, from the 19th century into the digital age.
